SEARCH
Package com.example.eventlottery.events

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventlottery.events.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Event extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an event in the Event Lottery system.

Each Event contains identifying information, timing details, an associated QR code, and a Waitlist for managing users who sign up for participation.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      Empty constructor required by Firestore for object deserialization. Initializes a non-null Waitlist to prevent crashes.

    • Event

      public Event(String name, String description, String location, String organizer, String image, Date startTime, Date endTime, List<String> filterTags)

    • Event

    • Event

      public Event(String id, String name, String description, String location, String organizer, String image, Date startTime, Date endTime)
      Constructs a new Event with given details.

      This constructor generates a new UUID for the event.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the event
      description - a description of the event
      location - the location of the event
      organizer - the name or ID of the event organizer
      image - the image URL or path
      startTime - the start time of the event
      endTime - the end time of the event

    • findEventById

      public static int findEventById(ArrayList<Event> events, String eventId)
      Searches for an Event in an ArrayList of events.
      Parameters:
      events - The Event ArrayList to be searched.
      eventId - The Event ID that will be compared to the Event ID of the events in the ArrayList.
      Returns:
      The index of an event if found, otherwise returns -1.

    • drawLotteryWinners

      public List<User> drawLotteryWinners(int capacity)
      Runs the lottery for this event and stores the selected winners internally. Any previous winners are cleared before the new draw. Only draws chosen entrants
      Parameters:
      capacity - the number of winners to select (must be ≥ 0 and not larger than the current wait-list size)
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable view of the newly selected winners; the same list can also be retrieved later via getChosenEntrants()

    • getChosenEntrants

      public List<User> getChosenEntrants()
